sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词含有"伸展，延长"或"延伸"之意。
means: extend ： 指时间或空间的延长，也可指影响和使用范围等的扩大。
lengthen ： 指把长度或期限拉长或延长，其反义是shorten。
stretch ： 指长度的延伸以及宽度的增加。
prolong ： 通常指时间上延长得超过了一般或正常的限度。

sentence.Network_en: It is better to stretch the tight muscles first.
sentence.Network_cn: 最好先伸展一下僵硬的肌肉。

sentence.Network_en: I stopped at the square and got out to stretch my legs.
sentence.Network_cn: 我在广场处停下来，下车活动活动腿脚。

sentence.Network_en: I'm trying to move on and stretch myself with something different.
sentence.Network_cn: 我正想换工作，想尝试点不一样的事情来挑战一下自己。

jx.jx_en_mean: with a part of one's body fully extended

jx.jx_cn_mean: 不停地，连续地，一口气地

lj.lj_ly: I often had to work for over twenty hours at a stretch.
lj.lj_ls: 我经常不得不连续工作20小时以上。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that something is just possible but only with difficulty or in extreme circumstances

lj.lj_ly: it is aimed at one age group, adults, or, at a stretch, business studies students.
lj.lj_ls: 它的目标是一个年龄组的人，即成年人，或者勉强扩大到包括商科学生。

phrase.cizu_name: by no (或 not by any) stretch of the imagination

jx.jx_en_mean: used to emphasize that something is definitely not the case
jx.jx_cn_mean: 任凭如何异想天开也不是，怎么想象也不是

lj.lj_ly: by no stretch of the imagination could Carl ever be called good-looking.
lj.lj_ls: 卡尔无论如何也称不上好看。

jx.jx_en_mean: go for a short walk, typically after sitting in one place for some time
allow or do something not usually acceptable, typically as a result of the particular circumstances

lj.lj_ly: since your daughter is one of my regular patients, I'm stretching a point.
lj.lj_ls: 既然你的女儿常来我这里看病，我就破一次例。

lj.lj_ly: since your daughter is one of my regular patients, I'm stretching a point.
lj.lj_ls: 既然你的女儿常来我这里看病，我就破一次例。

jx.jx_en_mean: To go for a walk, especially after a lengthy period of sitting.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 散步：散步，尤指在长坐一段时间后

means.word_mean: 伸展;展开
其他释义
伸直;伸长
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English streccan, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch strekken and German strecken. The noun dates from the late 16th cent

encyclopedia.content: 据报道，法国著名艺术片导演Charles De Meaux的新片《Stretch》日前正在泰国曼谷拍摄，该片女一号为中国女星范冰冰，这是一部全英文对白的法国电影，也是范冰冰首次与外国导演合作的外语片。据悉，范冰冰于5月底前往曼谷拍戏

entry.def: Something that stretches over an area or distance covers or exists in the whole of that area or distance.

example.ex: The procession stretched for several miles...
example.tran: 游行队伍长达数英里。

example.ex: He had burns that stretched from his neck to his hips.
example.tran: 他从脖子到臀部均被烧伤。

entry.def: A stretch of road, water, or land is a length or area of it.

example.ex: It's a very dangerous stretch of road...
example.tran: 这是一段非常危险的路。

example.ex: This stretch of Lost River was broader and deeper.
example.tran: 洛斯特里弗的这片水域又宽又深。

entry.def: When you stretch, you put your arms or legs out straight and tighten your muscles.

example.ex: He yawned and stretched...
example.tran: 他打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒腰。

example.ex: Try stretching your legs and pulling your toes upwards...
example.tran: 试着双腿伸直并且向上拉伸脚趾。

entry.def: A stretch of time is a period of time.

example.ex: He was fluent in French, having spent stretches of time in Southern France.
example.tran: 他曾在法国南部呆过一段时间，法语流利。

example.ex: ...after an 18-month stretch in the army...
example.tran: 在部队生活了 18 个月后

entry.def: If an event or activity stretches or is stretched into a further period of time, it continues into that period, which is later than expected.

example.ex: ...as anti-abortion protests stretched into their second week...
example.tran: 随着反堕胎抗议进入第二周

example.ex: The talks could be stretched into the summer of 1993.
example.tran: 该谈判可能会延续至 1993 年夏天。

entry.tran: (从一个时间)持续(至另一个时间)
entry.def: If something stretches from one time to another, it begins at the first time and ends at the second, which is longer than expected.

example.ex: ...a working day that stretches from seven in the morning to eight at night.
example.tran: 从早上 7 点持续到晚上 8 点的工作日

entry.def: If a group of things stretch from one type of thing to another, the group includes a wide range of things.

example.ex: ...a trading empire, with interests that stretched from chemicals to sugar.
example.tran: 从化学制品到食糖均有涉足的贸易帝国

entry.def: When something soft or elastic stretches or is stretched, it becomes longer or bigger as well as thinner, usually because it is pulled.

example.ex: The cables are designed not to stretch...
example.tran: 该电缆不能拉伸。

example.ex: Ease the pastry into the corners of the tin, making sure you don't stretch it.
example.tran: 将油酥面团小心地移至烤盘的各角，注意不要把它拉长。

entry.def: Stretch fabric is soft and elastic and stretches easily.

example.ex: ...stretch fabrics such as Lycra.
example.tran: 莱卡等有弹性的织物

example.ex: ...stretch cotton swimsuits.
example.tran: 弹力棉制泳衣

entry.def: If you stretch an amount of something or if it stretches, you make it last longer than it usually would by being careful and not wasting any of it.

example.ex: They're used to stretching their budgets...
example.tran: 他们习惯于精打细算。

example.ex: During his senior year his earnings stretched far enough to buy an old car.
example.tran: 他上年纪时省下的收入足够买一辆旧车了。

entry.tran: 刚能够节约下来(或支付)
entry.def: If your resources can stretch to something, you can just afford to do it.

example.ex: She suggested to me that I might like to start regular savings and I said Well, I don't know whether I can stretch to that.
example.tran: 她建议我可以开始定期存钱，我说我还不知道钱是不是够花呢。

entry.def: If something stretches your money or resources, it uses them up so you have hardly enough for your needs.

example.ex: The drought there is stretching American resources...
example.tran: 那里的旱灾正在耗尽美国的财力物力。

example.ex: Public expenditure was being stretched to the limit by having to support 3 million unemployed people.
example.tran: 因为要救济 300 万失业人口，公共支出即将被耗尽。

entry.tran: 使竭尽所能;使全力以赴;使拿出全部本领
entry.def: If you say that a job or task stretches you, you mean that you like it because it makes you work hard and use all your energy and skills so that you do not become bored or achieve less than you should.

example.ex: I'm trying to move on and stretch myself with something different...
example.tran: 我正想换工作，想尝试点不一样的事情来挑战一下自己。

example.ex: They criticised the quality of teaching, claiming pupils were not stretched enough.
example.tran: 他们批评教学质量太差，声称没有使学生们发挥出潜质。

entry.tran: (通常指为够到某东西而)尽量伸长手臂
entry.def: If you are at full stretch, your arm is straight and extended as far as possible, usually because you are trying to reach something that is almost too far away.

example.ex: He offered his lighter at full stretch.
example.tran: 他伸长胳膊把打火机递了过去。

entry.def: If you are at full stretch, you are using the maximum amount of effort or energy.

example.ex: Everyone would be working at full stretch.
example.tran: 每个人都将全力以赴。

entry.tran: 任凭怎么想也(不);再怎么说也(不)
entry.def: If you say that something is not true or possible by any stretch of the imagination, you are emphasizing that it is completely untrue or absolutely impossible.

example.ex: Her husband was not a womaniser by any stretch of the imagination...
example.tran: 她老公绝对不是个拈花惹草的人。

example.ex: By no stretch of the imagination could his speech be described as impersonal.
example.tran: 他的演讲再怎么说也不缺乏人情味。

entry.tran: (久坐之后)散散步，活动活动腿脚
entry.def: If you stretch your legs, you go for a short walk, usually after you have been sitting down for a long time.

example.ex: I stopped at the square and got out to stretch my legs.
example.tran: 我在广场处停下来，下车活动活动腿脚。

entry.tran: 牵强附会;勉强说得过去
entry.def: If you stretch a point, you describe something in a way which is not accurate, although it may be partly true.

example.ex: It is stretching a point to call this censorship.
example.tran: 把这称为审查有点儿牵强。

means.word_mean: 1. a large and unbroken expanse or distance;
2. the act of physically reaching or thrusting out
3. a straightaway section of a racetrack
4. exercise designed to extend the limbs and muscles to their full extent
5. extension to or beyond the ordinary limit;
6. an unbroken period of time during which you do something;

sentences.sentence: "he did a stretch in the federal penitentiary"

means.word_mean: 7. the capacity for being stretched
1. occupy a large, elongated area;

sentences.sentence: "The park stretched beneath the train line"

means.word_mean: 2. extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body;

sentences.sentence: "Extend your right arm above your head"

means.word_mean: 3. extend or stretch out to a greater or the full length;
4. become longer by being stretched and pulled;
5. make long or longer by pulling and stretching;
6. lie down comfortably;

sentences.sentence: "To enjoy the picnic, we stretched out on the grass"

means.word_mean: 7. pull in opposite directions;

sentences.sentence: "During the Inquisition, the torturers would stretch their victims on a rack"

means.word_mean: 8. extend the scope or meaning of; often unduly;
9. corrupt, debase, or make impure by adding a foreign or inferior substance; often by replacing valuable ingredients with inferior ones;
10. increase in quantity or bulk by adding a cheaper substance;

sentences.sentence: "stretch the soup by adding some more cream"
"extend the casserole with a little rice"

means.word_mean: 11. extend one's body or limbs;

sentences.sentence: "Let's stretch for a minute--we've been sitting here for over 3 hours"

means.word_mean: 1. having an elongated seating area;
2. easily stretched;

list.explanation: (爵士乐界用语)无拘朿地进行演奏

example.zh: 她泰然自若地演奏着，大家都静静地听着。

auth_sentence.content: It was not a pleasant situation by any stretch.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was not a pleasant situation by any stretch.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was not a pleasant situation by any stretch.

auth_sentence.content: The networks of paddies stretch far down the valleys.
auth_sentence.res_content: The networks of paddies stretch far down the valleys.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The networks of paddies stretch far down the valleys.

auth_sentence.content: The worm stretch and pull itself to move forward.
auth_sentence.res_content: The worm stretch and pull itself to move forward.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The worm stretch and pull itself to move forward.

Sentence.sentence: Some of this you do whenever you stretch.
The general principle is simple: whenever the body has been in one position for a while, it is good to briefly stretch it in an opposite position
Although no form of matter yet discovered moves as fast as or faster than light, scientific experiments have already confirmed that accelerated motion causes a traveler's time to be stretched.
For instance, the idea of the fall-to-spring"school year"hasn't changed much since before the American Revolution, when we were a summer stretch no longer makes sense.

The average amount of time students now take to complete an undergraduate degree has stretched to six years and seven months as students interrupted by work, inconvenienced by unavailable classes, or lured by one more football season find it hard to graduate.
I try not to go online till my day's writing is finished, and I moved from Manhattan to rural Japan in part so I could more easily survive for long stretches entirely on foot.

means.word_mean: 伸展; 拉紧

sentences.cn: 他站起身, 伸了伸懒腰。

means.word_mean: 延伸

sentences.en: The road stretches uphill at a steep slope.
sentences.cn: 这条路以陡峭的坡度向山上延伸。

means.word_mean: 伸展, 延伸, 延续

sentences.en: He had a good stretch on the bed.
sentences.cn: 他在床上痛快地伸了个懒腰。

means.word_mean: 一段时间, 一段路程, 一段水域

sentences.en: I see nothing but a small stretch of road immediately ahead.
sentences.cn: 除了近在眼前的一小段路之外什么也看不见。

means.word_mean: 损伤，扭伤(脚踝等)

sentences.en: He stretched his left foot when he jumped for the second time.
sentences.cn: 他第二次试跳时扭伤了左脚。

means.word_mean: 使(飞机、电厂等)改型

sentences.en: The common weapons should be stretched every ten years.
sentences.cn: 常规武器应该十年一换代。

means.word_mean: 伸展四肢地躺着(常与 out 连用)

sentences.en: to stretch out on a couch
sentences.cn: 舒展身体躺在长沙发上

means.word_mean: 伸手；伸手去拿

sentences.en: He stretched into his pocket for some money.
sentences.cn: 他伸手到口袋，掏出了一些钱。

jushi.english: The road stretches uphill at a steep slope.
jushi.chinese: 这条路以陡峭的坡度向山上延伸。

jushi.english: The sea stretches as far as the horizon and beyond.
jushi.chinese: 大海一直伸展到地平线以外。
